result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle R Tharalson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle R Tharalson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle R Tharalson was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Comply with all conditions imposed by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle R Tharalson

defendant.name: Tharalson, Kyle R

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on January 24, 2018 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
09:45 16CM121,16TR686,16TR687 also at this time. Defendant Kyle R Tharalson in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: 16CT78--plead to count 1, dismiss count 2, test .175, requests minimum guidelines $1555.00 fine, 20 days jail, huber after 48 hours, 15 month revocation; 16CM121, plead to count 1, S/W 1 year, dismiss count 2; 16TR686 plead guilty $358.00; 16TR687 dismiss. Parties agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 16CM121,  Facts are correct,  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS,  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1 in 16CM121, court dismisses count 2.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 in 16CT78,  Facts are correct,  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS,  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1 in 16CT78, court dismisses count 2. Def pleads guilty to 16TR686, court finds def. guilty and orders forfeiture in the amount of $358.00 1 year to pay. Court dismisses 16TR687.
Court orders 16CM121 count 1: S/W 1 year, follow conditions of agent, court costs $443 which includes DNA Sample and Surcharge, due over time of probation
Court orders 16CT78 count 1:  
 $1555.00  Fine 1 year to pay
   14 Months Revocation of Driver License
   20 Days Jail are Imposed. Defendant will report to jail May 19, 2017 at 7:00 pm to serve his first 48 hours without huber.  The defendant will be furloughed until June 14, 2017 at 10:00  AM which at that time the defendant will return to the Pierce Co. Jail to serve the remaining 18  days of sentence on huber/work release.  Release date: June 26, 2017.
Assessment and Driver Safety Plan must be completed
IID must be installed for a period of  1  years. $50.00 IID Surcharge is imposed. The IID requirement will commence when the defendant obtains any type of drivers license or when the defendant decides to drive w/o a valid driver license.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:14

11:02 16CT78 and 16TR686 and 16TR687 also at this time. Defendant Kyle R Tharalson in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich, no resolution at this time. Parties will let court know if a resolution is reached, scheduled for trial in March. 11:04

Final pre-trial on February 14, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on March 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.
From Clerk to Defendant informing of wage assignment payments that are needed and public defender's phone number.
From defendant's employer to court, defendant is no longer employed at place listed on wage assignment.
Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 15, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

10:22 Defendant Kyle R Tharalson in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CT78, 16TR686, and 16TR687 heard at this time. Defendant has copy of complaints.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Court gives constitutional rights to the court room as a group. Each Defendant in a group exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to all cases. Court rec/enter. OSullinvan: $500 signature bond on 16CM121 and 16CT78. Def has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
